Class FileInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileInfo

  • public class FileInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a class that will read each directory or file name in a path, and if that pathname exists in the volume, it will read and print the data contained there; both in UTF-8 and Hexadecimal.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileInfo(Inode inode, java.lang.String[] path)
      Constructor of the FileInfo class

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int findPath(java.lang.String path)
      This class calculates the inode number, needed to read the data contained in the block that the inode points to If there was no match, method returns integer 0
      void getFileInfo()
      This method will call findPath() method, to get the number of the inode, if the names in spli_path array match the names in the volume If the inode number is 0, the program will be terminated.
      void printBlockData(int startByte)
      This method will print the data contained in a file or the metadata from the inode, if it is a Directory
      void readBlockData(Inode inode)
      This method will read the block pointers values of an inode and if a pointer points to real data, it will call the appropriate methods to print that data.
      void readDblIndirectData(int startByte)
      This method will read the double indirect data block and if data exists it will call readIndirectData()
      void readHexData(java.util.ArrayList<byte[]> raw)
      This method will read byte arrays from a list of byte arrays and print the content in a readable Hexadecimal format, with 26 hex characters in each line for readability
      void readIndirectData(int startByte)
      This method will read the indirect data block and if data exists it will call printBlockData()
      void readTrplIndirectData(int startByte)
      This method will read the triple indirect data block and if data exists it will call readDblIndirectData()

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileInfo

        public FileInfo(Inode inode,
                java.lang.String[] path)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor of the FileInfo class
        Parameters:
        inode - is the inode that this class will use to read data
        path - is the array of names of directoriesandfiles, that the program will compare to the names of directories and files in the volume
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - e

    • Method Detail

      • getFileInfo

        public void getFileInfo()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method will call findPath() method, to get the number of the inode, if the names in spli_path array match the names in the volume If the inode number is 0, the program will be terminated. The method will then parse the bytes to read, to the Inode instance, by calculating the offset based on the inode number that the path returns. If data exists, this method will call the readBlockData() method, to read and print the data in a human-readable way and then it will call the readHexData, in order to read and print that same data in Hexadecimal format
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - e

      • findPath

        public int findPath(java.lang.String path)
             throws java.io.IOException
        This class calculates the inode number, needed to read the data contained in the block that the inode points to If there was no match, method returns integer 0
        Parameters:
        path - is the name of the directory or file to look for
        Returns:
        the inode number that points to the data requested in the path
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - e

      • readHexData

        public void readHexData(java.util.ArrayList<byte[]> raw)
        This method will read byte arrays from a list of byte arrays and print the content in a readable Hexadecimal format, with 26 hex characters in each line for readability
        Parameters:
        raw - is the ArrayList with bytes that this method will read and print as hex

      • readBlockData

        public void readBlockData(Inode inode)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method will read the block pointers values of an inode and if a pointer points to real data, it will call the appropriate methods to print that data.
        Parameters:
        inode - is the Inode, whose block pointers will be read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - e

      • printBlockData

        public void printBlockData(int startByte)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method will print the data contained in a file or the metadata from the inode, if it is a Directory
        Parameters:
        startByte - is the offset of the data, obtained by the direct pointers to data in the inode.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - e

      • readIndirectData

        public void readIndirectData(int startByte)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        This method will read the indirect data block and if data exists it will call printBlockData()
        Parameters:
        startByte - is the offset of the data, obtained by the block pointers from the inode.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - e

      • readDblIndirectData

        public void readDblIndirectData(int startByte)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This method will read the double indirect data block and if data exists it will call readIndirectData()
        Parameters:
        startByte - is the offset of the data, obtained by the block pointers from the inode.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - e

      • readTrplIndirectData

        public void readTrplIndirectData(int startByte)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        This method will read the triple indirect data block and if data exists it will call readDblIndirectData()
        Parameters:
        startByte - is the offset of the data, obtained by the block pointers from the inode.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - e
